Seminar Series & Skills Workshops Reflections

ðŸ“– Seminar Series & Skills Workshops Reflections

ðŸ“Œ Semester 1

  • Introduction to the ePortfolio and Transition to the MSc (23/09/2024)
    Helped me quickly understand the structure and assessment requirements of the ePortfolio, supporting a smooth transition into the MSc.

  • Reflection, Goal Setting and Action Planning (30/09/2024)
    Introduced reflection models (e.g., Gibbs) and SMART goal-setting, which guided my academic and personal planning.

  • Practical Tools (Quarto and Friends, 14/10/2024)
    Provided hands-on training with Quarto, which became the foundation for preparing my ePortfolio and coursework.

  • Critical Reading and Journal Club (21/10/2024)
    Improved my ability to critically analyse academic papers and strengthened oral communication during journal discussions.

  • Finding and Evaluating Research: Library Services (04/11/2024)
    Enhanced my skills in literature search and database use, improving the efficiency of reviews and assignments.

  • Generative AI (07/11/2024)
    Offered a balanced perspective on opportunities and risks of generative AI, guiding my responsible use of AI in research.

  • Writing Workshop (11/11/2024)
    Strengthened my academic writing, particularly in structuring arguments and refining style.

  • Marketing of Yourself (18/11/2024, rescheduled)
    Showed me how to better present my skills and experiences through CVs, cover letters, and interviews.

  • ePortfolio Workshop (02/12/2024)
    Helped me align reflections with evidence and career goals for stronger ePortfolio impact.

ðŸ“Œ Semester 2

  • Research Project Workshop (13/01/2025)
    Supported planning of my dissertation, from research design to data management.

  • Ethics in Research (20/01/2025)
    Reinforced the importance of ethics, data privacy, and research accountability, especially relevant to EHR data.

  • Reproducibility Crisis (03/02/2025)
    Highlighted the importance of transparency and reproducibility, which I applied to my own coding and data management.

  • ePortfolio Workshop (10/02/2025)
    Helped refine my portfolio structure, ensuring coherence between reflections, evidence, and career narrative.

  • Resilience, Adaptability, Wellness (24/02/2025)
    Offered strategies to maintain mental health and adaptability under academic and personal pressure, essential during dissertation writing.

  • Ethics in AI (24/03/2025)
    Explored fairness, bias, and responsibility in AI applications, directly relevant to my NLP + EHR research project.

ðŸ“Œ Semester 3

  • Interview Skills (12/05/2025)
    Improved my ability to answer both technical and behavioural questions confidently.

  • Posters and Presentations (02/06/2025)
    Provided practical guidance on poster and presentation design, directly supporting my MSc Poster Showcase.

  • ePortfolio Workshop (16/06/2025)
    Clarified submission requirements and helped finalise layout and reflective writing.

  • Cultural Competency in Research (30/06/2025)
    Emphasised cultural sensitivity in research design and interpretation, making me more aware of diversity issues in health data.

ðŸ“Œ Overall Reflection

  • Learning: Strengthened my academic writing, literature reading, and technical skills, enhancing both efficiency and outcomes.
  • Employability: Improved my CV, interview techniques, and career planning, building confidence in job applications.
  • Research: Ethics and AI seminars shaped my dissertation approach, ensuring that my RAG system design accounted for compliance and social responsibility.
